alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL AFFECT ALLEGHANY...SOUTHWESTERN BATH...NORTHWESTERN BOTETOURT COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL VIRGINIA AND EAST CENTRAL GREENBRIER COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN WEST VIRGINIA AND THE CITY OF COVINGTON... At 652 PM EDT, a shower was located over Callaghan, or near Covington, moving east at 20 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this shower. Locations impacted include... Covington... Clifton Forge... Neola... Hot Springs... Jordan Mines... Iron Gate... and Lake Moomaw. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
